title: Edgecombe County residents concerned about rising water levels following Debby
message:
EDGECOMBE COUNTY, N.C. (WITN) - Residents across Eastern North Carolina are still trying to recover from Tropical Storm Debby’s heavy rains and winds, but many are concerned the rising river levels could cause more problems.
After their experience living through Hurricane Floyd in 1999, every time there’s a storm, they get nervous about its impact on their Edgecombe County home.
“I think, ‘Oh lord, it’s going to happen again,’ but the water rises and nobody comes out to check on us.”After Debby made landfall in Eastern Carolina Thursday, the Tar River’s water levels have risen and flooded over many properties and roads.
The roads are back open, but resident Dylan Everette lives off of Highway 111 and says as the river levels go up, flooding could happen in the area again.
“We’re a little bit worried about what’s going to come next.”The National Weather Service has issued a flood warning for Edgecombe County until further notice.

title: Six ways the weather can scar , shift , and snap the Earth itself
message:
Ferocious storms are capable of changing communities for generations, leaving behind everlasting reminders of their raw power.
There’s no shortage of ways that the weather can alter the very ground beneath our feet.
Here are six events that can scar, shift, and crumble the Earth itself.
A tornado scar can last for years or even decades after particularly strong tornadoes.
The above satellite image shows the immediate aftermath of the EF-5 tornado that ripped through Joplin, Missouri, back in May 2011.

title: Debby finally moves out of the US , though power outages , flooding risks remain
message:
Nearly 170,000 customers in Ohio, New York, Pennsylvania and Vermont had no electricity Saturday afternoon according to PowerOutage.us, and some utilities said restoration could take days.
More than half the outages were in Ohio, where Debby-related storms including tornadoes blew through the northeastern part of the state on Wednesday.
They urged people to document damage before beginning cleanup efforts and to send them any images of the flooding.
About 19,000 Vermont homes and businesses remained without power Saturday afternoon, down from more than 44,000 the previous day.
"There is widespread, extensive damage in many locations," said Mike Burke, vice president of operations at Green Mountain Power.

title: Marlboro Co . leaders monitoring flooding after Tropical Storm Debby
message:
Communities across the Pee Dee are picking up the pieces after Tropical Storm Debby impacted the area this week.
Town leaders in Marlboro County said although water levels are dropping, flooding has not completely receded.
Director of Operations Jamal Campbell told ABC15 that with high temperatures coming back, leaders hope to see flooding decrease.
Residents were staying at Marlboro County High School after several people evacuated their homes.
Leaders said it was all hands-on deck for emergency crews through tropical storm Debby ensuring the safety of all residents.

title: Light earthquake , 4 . 7 mag strikes near Panguna in Papua New Guinea
message:
A light earthquake magnitude 4.7 (ml/mb) strikes 186 km NW of Panguna, Papua New Guinea (116 miles) on Sunday.
The earthquake occurred at a depth of 132.25 km (82 miles) below the earth’s surface.
Exact time and date of earthquake 11/08/24 / 2024-08-11 01:26:41 / August 11, 2024 @ 1:26 am UTC/GMT.
A tsunami warning has not been issued (Does not indicate if a tsunami actually did or will exist).
Read more about the earthquake, Seismometer information, Date-Time, Location, Distances, Parameters and details about this quake, recorded: 186 km NW of Panguna, Papua New Guinea.

title: Light earthquake , 4 . 2 mag strikes near Houma in Tonga
message:
A light earthquake with magnitude 4.2 (ml/mb) was reported 260 km W of Houma, Tonga (162 miles) on Sunday.
The epicenter was at a depth of 421.584 km (262 miles).
Exact time and date of earthquake 11/08/24 / 2024-08-11 04:03:40 / August 11, 2024 @ 4:03 am UTC/GMT.
Exact location of earthquake, longitude -177.8049 West, latitude -21.1087 South, depth = 421.584 km.
Read more about the earthquake, Seismometer information, Distances, Parameters, Date-Time, Location and details about this quake, that has occurred near: 260 km W of Houma, Tonga.

title: Light earthquake , 4 . 1 mag has occurred near Ashkāsham in Afghanistan
message:
A light earthquake magnitude 4.1 (ml/mb) strikes 31 kilometers (19 miles) from Ashkāsham in Afghanistan on Saturday.
The earthquake occurred at a depth of 90.462 km (56 miles) below the earth’s surface.
Earthquake epicenter was 83 km (51 miles) from Fayzabad (c. 44 400 pop), 40 km (25 miles) from Ishqoshim (c. 26 000 pop), 32 km (20 miles) from Ashkāsham (c. 12 100 pop), 47 km (29 miles) from Jurm (c. 12 100 pop).
Close country/countries that might be effected, Afghanistan (c. 29 121 000 pop), Tajikistan (c. 7 487 000 pop).
Read more about the earthquake, Seismometer information, Distances, Parameters, Date-Time, Location and details about this quake, that has occurred near: 31 km WSW of Ashkāsham, Afghanistan.

title: Light earthquake , 4 . 3 mag has occurred near Acajutla in El Salvador
message:
A light earthquake magnitude 4.3 (ml/mb) strikes 44 kilometers (27 miles) from Acajutla in El Salvador on Saturday.
The 4.3-magnitude earthquake has occurred at 19:06:17 / 7:06 pm (local time epicenter).
The earthquake occurred at a depth of 67.449 km (42 miles) below the earth’s surface.
Close country/countries that might be effected, El Salvador (c. 6 052 000 pop).
Read more about the earthquake, Seismometer information, Distances, Parameters, Date-Time, Location and details about this quake, that has occurred near: 44 km WSW of Acajutla, El Salvador.

title: Record high flooding impacts local crops
message:
SAVANNAH, Ga. (WTOC) - Over the past week, tropical storm Debby hit our area hard with record high flooding.
That flooding has not only impacted homes and infrastructure, but also crops.
WTOC spoke with a Forsyth Farmer’s Market representative to share how Coastal Empire and Lowcountry farmers have been affected.
A representative from the Forsyth Farmer’s Market said some farmers have already told her how their crops have been ruined for the season.
Basically, the crops, a lot of the crops, got washed out, literally,” said Interim Executive Director of Forsyth Farmers Market, Tina Saxe.

message:
A light earthquake magnitude 4.8 (ml/mb) strikes 18 kilometers (11 miles) from Miyazaki in Japan on Saturday.

title: First Alert Weather : Good timing for dry weather
message:
Breezy and dry conditions were a welcome relief for Western New York.
The remnants of Tropical Storm Debby brought flooding rain, which produced significant flooding for communities east of the Genesee Valley.
Portions of Wayne, Ontario, Yates, and Steuben counties measured between 1 and 4 inches of tropical rainfall.
Unfortunately, the dry weather will not last for the rest of the weekend.
It will turn breezy again with the high temperature in the middle 70s.

title: Remnants of Debby exit as another tropical wave brews over central Atlantic
message:
Remnants of Debby exit as another tropical wave brews over central AtlanticDespite Debby being downgraded to a post-tropical storm as it tracked north, it still brought a plethora of impacts across the Northeast on Friday.
While Debby departs the nation, all eyes are on another tropical wave over the central tropical Atlantic.
Parts of southeastern New Jersey reported over 8 inches -- Pennington, New Jersey, reported 8.67 inches of rain and Hopewell Township, New Jersey, reported 8.24 inches.
While multiple Tornado Warnings were issued across the Northeast, only one tornado was confirmed in New Paltz, New York.
Wind gusts ranged between 40 to 60 mph across portions of the Delmarva up through eastern Pennsylvania, New York and New Jersey.

title: Stuck in shelters
message:
But amid the electricity, water, and mosquito woes still affecting sections of the island, five weeks after the hurricane, several people are still in shelters, their houses unfit or unsafe to inhabit.
Overall, approximately 277 people in the parish sought refuge in emergency shelters during the natural disaster.
Grove Place is the last of Lewis’ shelters that is still operational.
The church was one of the contingency shelters in the parish.
All the others – and the 87 official shelters – were unoccupied last week, representatives from the St Elizabeth Municipal Corporation revealed.

title: Richmond Hill residents try to stay afloat amid historic flood levels
message:
RICHMOND HILL, Ga. (WTOC) - Debby may be gone, but Bryan County residents are still dealing with the storm’s fallout.
WTOC visited parts of Richmond Hill where people have been experiencing some of the worst flooding they’ve ever seen.
Residents are doing what they can to stay afloat as floodwaters threaten their homes and safety.
If people just don’t need their sandbags, we’re collecting them and bringing them to the people that actually do need them,” said Richmond Hill resident, Fallon Prisuta.
Flooding throughout Richmond Hill has already reached historic levels, and until rivers like the Ogeechee crest, more flooding is likely.

title: Helping Vermont | ScienceBlogs
message:
Photo of Vermont highway courtesy of Kyle CornellLast week, I had my long-awaited vacation semi-ruined when, thanks to Hurricane Irene, my flight back from the West Coast was cancelled.
I had to rent a car and drive across the country in a rush - not my favorite way to spend three and a half days.
But based on what I saw passing through New York, and what I've heard about the damage in Vermont, I can't complain: flooding has overturned homes, isolated entire towns, and destroyed everything some families own.
Text the word FOODNOW to 52000 to make a $10 donation that will show up on your next cellphone bill (this was even easier than PayPal!)
Vermont Farm Disaster Relief Fund (accepts PayPal - click on the pink box "give now" - or check)Vermont Irene Flood Relief Fund: raising money for flood relief for small Vermont businesses (click on "donate" in the top bar for PayPal and other options)I know for many of us, money is tight (you would not believe what it costs to rent a car one way cross-country), but do consider giving something if you can spare it.

title: Long County family faces aftermath of storm
message:
LONG COUNTY, Ga. (WTOC) - While many are just now seeing flooding at their homes, many are already facing the aftermath.
WTOC went back to Long County today where a family says they’ve lost everything.
What looks like a normal house on the outside, has been destroyed by floodwaters after tropical storm Debby made its way through Long County.
We got sandbags, I even put water inside the trashcan to see if I could lower the water in the garage,” said Sobrado.
Lingering effects of Debby will be most likely felt for weeks and for other families like Sobrado, help can’t come soon enough.

title: Snakes , baby squirrels , bird : Grand Strand snake chaser sees increase in animal relocation calls after Debby
message:
Snake chaser Hayden Cavender said this is due to higher wind and water levels after Debby.
He told WMBF News after storms, he expects to be busier, with calls increasing by 15 to 20 percent.
Cavender told WMBF News he has removed four cottonmouth snakes from the neighborhood in the last two days.
He wants people to be vigilant, as some of these snakes are venomous, but not to panic if they do come across a snake.
“They won’t come and outright try to grab you or try to attack you or try to bite you,” said Cavender.

title: Sarasota County opens resource center for residents impacted by Debby
message:
We take care of our people and that's really what we're striving our best to do," Sarasota County Public Information Officer Cole Washko said.
That's why on Saturday, more than 20 local and state agencies, including Sarasota County, opened a multi-agency resource center.
We want to be that answer and as well as some of the local and state agencies that are here.
Along with basic needs, residents can also get long-term support like help with navigating insurance claims or signing up for flood insurance.
We just want to encourage people to come out and get the help that they deserve and need," Washko said.

title: Turning less humid
message:
RICHMOND, Va. -- Less humid air will continue moving into the region during the day.
We will have a mix of clouds and sunshine with highs in the mid to upper 80s.
An isolated shower is possible near Norfolk and near the North Carolina line, but much of the area will be dry today.
Monday will be partly cloudy with highs in the mid 80s.
Highs will be in the low to mid 80s, with overnight lows in the low to mid 60s.

title: Orangeburg County neighbors heartbroken over 6 - year - old shooting death
message:
EUTAWVILLE, S.C. - Neighbors are reeling from news that a 6-year-old girl has died in Orangeburg County after what officials are calling an accidental shooting.
Orangeburg County deputies said they learned the girl had been shot in the head around 3:40 p.m. Wednesday by her 7-year-old brother.
4 dead in Orangeburg and Aiken County car crashes Four people are dead in Aiken and Orangeburg counties from car crashes in the last several days.
Flooding from tropical storm brings out snakes, other critters Tropical Storm Debby’s aftermath may not only bring flooding and debris but could also bring some unwanted guests into your neighborhood.
With flooding and evacuation alert, nightmare goes on in Bamberg County Bamberg County residents in the Edisto River basin were urged to evacuate immediately Friday afternoon as water levels rose.

title: The Weather Authority : Tropics Heating Up
message:
A well-organized tropical wave is spinning about 1000 west of the lesser Antilles Saturday night.
The NHC gives this a high probability (90%) of development over the next few days.
If this develops it would become Ernesto, only the 5th named storm of the 2024 Atlantic Hurricane season.
On it's current trajectory, steering winds would carry this through the Caribbean eventually near Florida's peninsula late next week.
Our pattern favors troughing over the eastern U.S next week, in this scenario any storm would stay over Atlantic waters and east of any landfall.

title: N . W . T . Highway 1 reopens after partial closure on Saturday
message:
In Northwest Territories, Highway 1 has fully reopened after wildfire smoke closed down part of the road early on Saturday afternoon, according to the N.W.T.
The highway was closed between the Highway 3 Junction and the Jean Marie River access road at around 1 p.m. on Saturday due to severe wildfire smoke.
The Sambaa K'e access road, which was also impacted by wildfire smoke, is still closed.
In an Facebook update saying the highway was reopened, the department said that drivers on Highway 1 should still expect smoky conditions.
Kennedy told CBC at 2 p.m. that the earlier closure was due to severe wildfire smoke caused by fires in the Dehcho as well as in Alberta and B.C., and no fires were dangerously close to the highway.

title: The Alexander Mountain Fire is Nearly at Full Containment
message:
A week and a half after the Alexander Mountain Fire started, the Larimer County Sheriff's Office informed the public that the Northern Colorado wildfire was almost fully contained.
Northern Colorado's Alexander Mountain FireOn Sunday, August 4, the Larimer County Assessor completed the property damage report from the wildfire and reported that 51 homes were either damaged or lost in the Alexander Mountain Fire according to KDVR.
The Joint Information Center for the Alexander Mountain Fire closed at noon on August 8, and will not reopen unless a new need arises.
The Storm Mountain and Cedar Park areas were heavily impacted by the Alexander Mountain Fire.
More information on the Alexander Mountain Fire containment efforts can be seen below from the Larimer County Sheriff's Office.

title: Canoe Road wildfire forces evacuation of south Valemount and Cedarside
message:
— An evacuation order has been issued for an area south of Valemount, British Columbia due to the out-of-control Canoe Road wildfire.
— An evacuation order has been issued for an area south of Valemount, British Columbia due to the out-of-control Canoe Road wildfire.
Officials say the wildfire poses a threat to human life and anyone in the area should leave immediately or call 911 if they are unable to.
Evacuees are being told to go to a welcome centre set up at the Robson Valley Community Centre in McBride, about 80 kilometres northwest of Valemount.
The Canoe Road wildfire was discovered on Aug. 10 and was 0.08 square kilometres in size as of that evening.

title: Fort Myers residents trapped on flooded street
message:
One of the roads that’s still suffering from the storm’s aftermath is Wildcat Drive in Fort Myers.
Some residents claimed emergency responders couldn’t get through due to the road conditions.
The road conditions are not only bad for first responders but for everyone who lives along Wildcat Drive.
Some drivers who live here can’t drive through the water since it may cause damage to their cars.
Jimmy Smith is one of the residents who has a four-wheel drive vehicle and he has lived in the community for years.

title: Weather Flash : Understanding the Drought Monitor
message:
However, the U.S. Drought Monitor (USDM) colors and numbers can make it confusing to understand the severity of a drought.
The drought monitor is released once a week on Thursdays for the previous week.
Drought Monitors are vital to farmers and people who work in agriculture, as drought conditions affect the water supply, crops, pastures and farm animals.
FORECAST: A quiet and pleasant night aheadThe creators of the drought monitor look at previous drought monitors, current conditions, rainfall, etc., to build the next monitor.
For the latest news, weather, sports, and streaming video, head to DC News Now | Washington, DC.

title: Eastlake family barricaded in a bathroom during the storms feel lucky to survive
message:
EASTLAKE, Ohio (WOIO) - We’re learning more incredible stories from the moment those powerful storms swept through Northeast Ohio on Tuesday.
Including a story of survival in Eastlake as tornado sirens sounded, and hurricane force winds blew through to do their damage.
Homeowner Susan Wilson-Marn of South Lake Shore was in the shower when she heard the tornado sirens she believes saved her life.
“Don’t ignore it.”In 23 years of living at her Eastlake home Wilson-Marn never remembers a storm that made her take cover.
So, I have a little cubby space in there and I threw everything I was storing from the cubby space and we just crammed ourselves into that space.

title: Gisborne triumphs 65 - 26 over Strathfieldsaye in BFNL clash | Bendigo Advertiser
message:
"The girls take it well.
They want to see each other do well, so it's nice they have that bond and connection on court and are content to come off when I ask.

title: Jairam Ramesh Calls For Review Of Great Nicobar Island Project By Parliamentary Panels
message:
New Delhi, Aug 11: Asserting that the mega infra project in Great Nicobar Island is a “grave threat” to the natural ecosystem, Congress leader Jairam Ramesh has urged Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav to suspend all clearances accorded to the project and called for its thorough and impartial review, including by the parliamentary committees concerned.
72,000 crore ‘Mega Infra Project’ in Great Nicobar Island is a grave threat to Great Nicobar Island’s tribal communities and natural ecosystem,” Ramesh said.
“The project has been rammed through in violation of all legal and policy safeguards for the protection of tribal groups,” Ramesh alleged.
“Given these numerous violations of due processes, all clearances accorded to this short-sighted project must be suspended.
The proposed project should be reviewed thoroughly and impartially, including by the Parliamentary committees concerned,” Ramesh said in his letter to Yadav.

title: Japanese megaquake fears trigger panic buying
message:
Panicked Japanese, fearful of another megaquake, ae now scooping up supplies in the aftermath of a magnitude 7.1 jolt in the south earlier this week.
"Potential sales restrictions are on the way," the sign said, adding that bottled water was already being rationed due to "unstable" procurement.
On Saturday morning the website of Japanese e-commerce giant Rakuten showed portable toilets, preserved food and bottled water topping the list of the most sought-after items.
Bar employee Kokoro Takeuchi said she had ordered bottled water online following Thursday's tremor.
Most seismologists believe the Friday jolt had no direct link to the Nankai Trough megaquake, citing distance.

title: Arborist recommends tree risk assessments post - Debby to prevent hazards
message:
After remnants of hurricane Debby hit NEPA on Friday, a focus has moved to the cleanup.
Many trees have fallen, or broken due to the heavy winds, but they may be at risk of further damage.
“When a tree has a wound, it doesn’t properly seal it, it’s gonna turn into a giant dead stub that’s gonna over time turn into a hazard.
So, we cut it properly, it heals properly, and there’s no hazard left,”Jimmy Lowe, a Climbing Arborist for Alan Krieg Fine Pruning.
Lowe suggests getting a Tree Risk Assessment done to lower the chances of the tree becoming a danger during another storm.

title: Drought conditions increase for portions of state
message:
Below normal rainfall and higher seasonable temperatures have resulted in an increase of drought coverage and intensity since the early July.
The majority of the islands are under moderate drought conditions with southern Maui (east of Maalaea Bay) experiencing extreme drought.
One of the fire weather indices such as the Keetch-Byram Drought Index (KDBI) is a tool that is used to better determine the fire weather threat.
This index has been on the rise and will likely exceed fire weather threat thresholds by the end of August.
This index employs such factors as locally drying fuels, strong winds and lower relative humidities that, in combination, all lead to enhancing the fire weather threat within a drought.

title: Jordan Lake closes due to flooding as storm risk continues through the weekend
message:
Jordan Lake closes due to flooding as storm risk continues through the weekendFlooding continues to be a problem throughout the Triangle.
Flooding continues to be a problem throughout the Triangle.
Flooding continues to be a problem throughout the Triangle.
RALEIGH, N.C. (WTVD) -- Flooding continues to be a problem throughout the Triangle.
"We have flooding at all of our accesses at Jordan Lake, so all campsites and day-use areas are currently closed.

title: Heavy rain causes flooding and disruptions across Lahore early morning
message:
Downpour inundates low-lying areas in LahorePakistan Pakistan Downpour inundates low-lying areas in LahoreSignificant rainfall occurred in Gulberg, Kalma Chowk, Jail Road, and Ferozepur RoadFollow on Updated On: Sun, 11 Aug 2024 18:36:15 PKTLAHORE (Dunya News) – An early morning downpour on Sunday flooded the low-lying areas of the provincial capital.
The torrential rain was reported across various parts of the city, including Lakshmi Chowk, Abbott Road, Shimla Pahari, and Mall Road.
Gulberg, Kalma Chowk, Jail Road, and Ferozepur Road also experienced significant rainfall.
Heavy rain caused flooding in areas such as Qartaba Chowk, Chouburji, Islampura, Band Road, Gulshan-e-Ravi, Samanabad, Mughalpura, Tajpura, Farukhabad, and Chowk Nakhuda, leading to inundation in low-lying areas and power outages in several areas.
Meanwhile, residents of twin cities (Islamabad and Rawalpindi) continued to grapple with monsoon rains, further worsening the already challenging conditions in low-lying areas.

title: Ancient Pyramids Collapse In Mexico , Local Tribe Warns Of  Impending Doom
message:
The Purepecha defeated the Aztecs and ruled for 400 yearsTwo pyramids in Mexico used by an ancient tribe for human sacrifices have caved in in a "supernatural sign of impending doom".
The pyramid was built by ancestors of the modern Purepecha people, a bloodthirsty tribe that defeated the Aztecs.
Historians say the ancient Purepecha tribe used the Yacata pyramids for human sacrifices to their most important god Kurikweri.
The Yacata pyramids are found in the archaeological site of Ihuatzio in the Michoacan state.
It said: "On Tuesday night, a collapse occurred in the central part of the southern facade of one of the pyramidal bases of the Ihuatzio Archaeological Zone.

title: An amazing amount of water : Checking in on Naples after Friday flooding
message:
Looking in on Naples a day after serious floodingNAPLES, N.Y. — The Rochester area didn’t feel the effects of Debby too badly, it was a different story about an hour away, in Naples.
He found Naples Creek still flowing heavily more than 24 hours after the heavy rains.
News10NBC spoke with the owner of Joseph’s Wayside Market, a farm stand providing locally grown produce, baked goods and more.
He says that in his many years of working here, he’s never seen flooding quite like Friday’s.
Joseph says the flooding didn’t damage any of his products or farm stand.

title: Natural disasters affect 26 million people across China
message:
BEIJING: More than 26 million people across China were affected to varying degrees by natural disasters in July, which mainly involved heavy rain, flooding, typhoons and geological disasters, according to an assessment by the country's top disaster relief authorities.
In July, natural disasters in China were mainly characterized by heavy rain, flooding, typhoons and geological disasters, with the occurrences of wind and hail, earthquakes and forest fires also reported to varying degrees.
The report also highlighted that due to extreme heavy rainfall, many regions across the country experienced severe rainstorms, flooding and geological disasters, including urban waterlogging, mountain torrents, mudslides and landslides.
On July 20, sudden mountain torrents and mudslides caused by heavy rain in Hanyuan county, Sichuan province, led to 41 deaths and disappearances.
Subsequently, the remnants of the typhoon moved inland, bringing extreme heavy rainfall to Hunan, causing flooding and geological disasters that affected 1.22 million people in the province, and leaving 94 people dead or missing.

title: Wildfire burns 10 acres northwest of Mt . Charleston
message:
The United States Forest Service reports a wildfire northwest of Mt.
According to , the Trough Spring fire is near Cold Creek, Nevada which is in Clark County.
Officials say the fire has burned 10 acres.
The fire is on the west side of Wheeler Pass.

title: Downtown Nichols devastated by floodwaters , Main Street junction submerged
message:
ABC 15 sent a crew to check on the flooding in Nichols.
Our crew then attempted to enter Nichols via State Road S-34-60 but it was also closed.
Traveling on Hwy 9W, ABC 15 found a few houses that were taking on heavy water from the Little Pee Dee River.
A road barrier blocked entrance to downtown Nichols, but with help from a Marion County Sheriff's deputy our crew was able to enter to see the damage.
Main Street at the junction, and several streets near it were completely flooded, and there was water on Nichols Street, Mullins Street, and Main Street at the intersection with Lodge Street.

title: Focus on research : Penn State tornado scientists take us inside the real world of storm chasing
message:
Editor’s note: The Focus on Research column highlights different research projects and topics being explored at Penn State.
With the new “Twisters” movie hitting theaters, we’ve been getting questions about storm-chasing – or storm intercepts, as we call them.
Some will be launching weather balloons at various distances from the tornado, while others will be placing “pods” containing weather instruments directly in the path of the tornado.
We often target areas around the tornado or within other parts of the storm to understand how the rotation forms.
Scientists take calculated risks when they’re storm chasing – enough to collect crucial data, but never putting their teams in too much danger.

title: Evacuation warning issued for Twin Oaks and Sand Canyon area due to Blue Fire
message:
KERN COUNTY, Calif — Another wildfire igniting in Kern County Saturday, northeast of the Twin Oaks and the Sand Canyon area.
Kern County Fire crews and several aircraft are currently working to contain the Blue Fire.
An evacuation warning has been issued for zone KRN-744 in the Twin Oaks and Sand Canyon area.
At last check, the fire has burned 112 acres.
But, according to reports, the fire could possibly grow to at least 500 acres.

title: Parts of the Lowcountry facing flood aftermath
message:
MONCKS CORNER, S.C. (WCSC) - After a week of heavy rainfall, parts of the Lowcountry are still recovering from some flooding.
We need to stand up and if you see somebody that needs some help we need to help them,” community member Rhys Buckner said.
“There were some boats turned over, a boat turned over and then there was a lot of water coming from the marsh area,” he said.
The Labans said the water is so deep, when someone drives on the road it will create a wake in neighbors’ yards.
“If somebody does need a hand, you just got to say something,” Laban said.

title: Wildfire in Tiller / Drew area prompts immediate evacuations
message:
A wildfire in the Tiller/Drew area near Canyonville prompted a level 3 Evacuation Notice from the Douglas County Sheriff's Office (DCSO) for all homes on Devils Knob Rd andCrume Ranch Lane.
The Fire, known as the Rainville Fire on Watch Duty, gained 200-300 acres as of 4:30 p.m. August 10.
To stay updated on evacuation notices, visit the DCSO Facebook page

title: Banana crisis hits Maroon Pride after Beryl wrath | Lead Stories
message:
The businessman is hoping to locate high-quality produce as he believes there may be a shortage of Maroon’s Pride banana chips “sooner than later because if we don’t have the raw material, then we can’t produce anything”.
Treleven said that while an increase in the price of the banana chips is currently not on the table, they are watching the situation as it unfolds.
“Maybe we have fi go raise up banana chips, but we nuh wah do it suh.
We are going to need some fertilizers and farming supplies,” Chambers added, while sharing that he hopes to get Maroon’s Pride banana chips on international shelves after recovery.
Harris is anticipating that the majority of the banana farmers in St James will be in a much better position by next May.

title: For 400 years , Indigenous tribes buffered climate impact on wildfires in the American Southwest
message:
Front PageFor 400 years, Indigenous tribes buffered climate's impact on wildfires in the American SouthwestBy SMUAug 11, 2024Dallas, Texas (SMU)  Devastating megafires are becoming more common, in part, because the planet is warming.
But the pattern was broken when Native American tribes performed traditional burning practices, according to the groups study published in Science Advances.
Whats remarkable is that this impact of Native American fire management was evident across hundreds of square kilometers, said lead author Roos.
Native American or Indigenous fire practices have shown us how people living in fire-prone places can positively coexist with wildfire in sustainable ways by actively engaging with it, he said.
For millennia, many Native American tribes living in the US Southwest held controlled burns of small trees, grasses and shrubs at regular intervals to clear out underbrush and encourage new plant growth.

title: Status Yellow rain warning to come into effect tonight for 14 counties
message: The alert, covering Donegal, Leitrim and Sligo, will come into effect at midnight on Monday and last until 4am.

title: Caller calls out Essendon fans wanting Brad Scott sacked after the Gold Coast loss
message:
Caller Ian has called out the Essendon fans wanting head coach Brad Scott sacked after the loss to the Gold Coast Suns on Saturday night.
The loss rules the Bombers out of finals contention, with their finals win drought set to continue for another year.
“That is a very good call,” Richo said.

title: TWO - A - DAY : JUAREZ - LINCOLN
message:
TWO-A-DAY: JUAREZ - LINCOLNJuarez - Lincoln is looking to overcome a 4-year winning drought under new Head Coach Daniel Cortez.
It all starts with a culture and mental change.
"We're preaching positive energy equals positive results.
If we do things the right way, with good intentions, go hard in practice, take care of business in the classroom the results will be there."
said Cortez.

title: Tungabhadra gate washed away : Minister Payyavula Keshav underscores urgency of restoring it
message:
Minister of Finance and Legislative Affairs Payyavula Keshav underscored the urgency of restoring the Tungabhadra Dam Gate at Hospet in Karnataka, which was washed away due to flooding into the reservoir on Saturday night (August 10, 2024.)
Minister Payyavula Keshav conveyed his message from New Delhi on Sunday (August 11, 2024), concerning the Andhra Pradesh government’s swift action in response to the incident.
Minister Keshav called for the immediate alertness of State authorities on coming to know of the reservoir gate being washed away.
The Minister stressed on the need for measures to expedite restoration of the dam gate and address potential remedies, including alternative gate designs and temporary water stoppage strategies.
Mr. Keshav assured that the government was committed to ensuring minimal disruption of the lives and livelihoods of farmers reliant on the Tungabhadra Dam.

title: Flood alert issued as four days of unrelenting rains bring twin cities to standstill
message:
Heavy rains continued to lash the twin cities of Rawalpindi and Islamabad on Sunday, marking the fourth consecutive day of downpours that began on Saturday night.
The intense rainfall led to flooding in low-lying areas, while the water level in Nallah Lai surged between 10.5 and 14.5 feet, prompting authorities to issue a pre-alert.
The department reported 83 mm of rainfall at PMD, 26 mm at Golra, 26 mm at Bokhara, 34 mm at Shamsabad, and 16 mm at Saidpur.
The heavy downpour caused the water level in Nallah Lai to rise to 14.5 feet at Katarian Bridge and 10.5 feet at Gawalmandi, leading to a pre-alert warning.
However, as the rain subsided, the water level in Nallah Lai quickly dropped to 6 feet at Katarian and 5 feet at Gawalmandi.

title: Trump tale of a harrowing helicopter ride and emergency landing ? Didnt happen , Willie Brown says
message:
Jerry Brown who rode with Trump in a helicopter in 2018 to survey wildfire damage, and no emergency landing was reported.
We thought maybe this was the end.”He went on: “We were in a helicopter, going to a certain location together, and there was an emergency landing.
But Brown told the San Francisco Chronicle that he's never been in a helicopter with Trump.
“You would have known if I had gone down on a helicopter with Trump,” Brown told the paper.
A spokesperson for the Democrat, Izzy Gardon, said Friday there was no problem with the flight, no emergency landing, and no conversation about Harris.

title: Tropical weather maker update
message:
The potential next tropical weather maker continues to show signs of getting more organized.
A tropical wave far out over the Atlantic Ocean continues to have a high formation chance.
Through seven days the formation chance is 90 percent and it's possible advisories will be issued during the early to middle part of next week.
Advisories will be issued if the weather maker becomes a tropical depression or named storm.
It's not likely the system will further develop over the weekend but the formation chance through 2 days has increased to 50 percent.

title: Trump tale of a harrowing helicopter ride and emergency landing ? Didnt happen , Willie Brown says
message:
Former President Donald Trump mixed up two prominent politicians from California when he told a harrowing tale of almost crashing in a helicopter.
Jerry Brown who rode with Trump in a helicopter in 2018 to survey wildfire damage, and no emergency landing was reported.
We thought maybe this was the end.”He went on: “We were in a helicopter, going to a certain location together, and there was an emergency landing.
“You would have known if I had gone down on a helicopter with Trump,” Brown told the paper.
A spokesperson for the Democrat, Izzy Gardon, said Friday there was no problem with the flight, no emergency landing, and no conversation about Harris.

title: More than 400 lightning strikes spark eight new wildfires , BC Wildfire Services says
message:
BRITISH COLUMBIA — The agency monitoring wildfires in British Columbia said eight new blazes sprang up in the southern regions of the area served by the Northwest Fire Centre, after more than 400 lightning strikes hit the area on Friday night.
BRITISH COLUMBIA — The agency monitoring wildfires in British Columbia said eight new blazes sprang up in the southern regions of the area served by the Northwest Fire Centre, after more than 400 lightning strikes hit the area on Friday night.
The BC Wildfire service said four of the new fires are burning west of the Witset community, which is home to about 611 on-reserve members.
The wildfire service website showed there were six blazes of note in B.C., including the Hullcar Mountain wildfire that was burning approximately 13 kilometres northwest of Armstrong and is roughly 7.1 square kilometres in size.
BC Wildfire Service Wildfire Officer Darcy MacLeod said on Friday that they had to pause the proposed planned ignition because of thunderstorms that were passing by this fire, which brought unfavourable weather conditions.

title: More than 400 lightning strikes spark eight new wildfires , BC Wildfire Services says
message:
The BC Wildfire service said four of the new fires are burning west of the Witset community, which is home to about 611 on-reserve members.
More than 380 active wildfires were burning across the province, and a summary from the BC Wildfire Service said there was a “significant chance” of lightning in the southern Interior which could both start new fires and fuel existing ones.
The wildfire service website showed there were six blazes of note in B.C., including the Hullcar Mountain wildfire that was burning approximately 13 kilometres northwest of Armstrong and is roughly 7.1 square kilometres in size.
The service also warned travellers smoke may be visible from the communities of Armstrong and Enderby as a planned ignition on the Hullcar Mountain wildfire was underway Saturday.
BC Wildfire Service Wildfire Officer Darcy MacLeod said on Friday that they had to pause the proposed planned ignition because of thunderstorms that were passing by this fire, which brought unfavourable weather conditions.

title: Chris Evans Responds To Ryan Reynold Shout Out For His Deadpool & Wolverine Cameo As Johnny Storm :  He Gives The Best Gifts
message:
Ryan Reynolds thanked Evans in a social media post on Friday, August 9, 2024.
The Deadpool star took to Instagram to appreciate him for his appearance as Johnny Storm (the Human Torch from Marvel's Fantastic Four) in Deadpool & Wolverine.
He also went ahead to praise Ryan by saying, "There may be an ocean of Chrises, but only one Ryan Reynolds," who gives the most thoughtful gifts.
Fans may re-watch Deadpool & Wolverine starring Ryan Reynolds, Hugh Jackman, Chris Evans, Emma Corrin, and more in memory of Jonathan Lowell Spencer Storm still available in theatres worldwide.
ALSO READ: 'Flame Off': Ryan Reynolds Pens Heartfelt Note For Chris Evans' Human Torch As He Reveals Part Of Deadpool & Wolverine's Theme Is 'Saying Goodbye'

title: Wildfire on west side of Okanagan Lake near Fintry now under control
message:
The fire is currently spot sized and out of controlA new wildfire has sparked near Fintry Provincial Park on the west side of Okanagan Lake Saturday, Aug. 10, 2024.
1 / 1 A new wildfire has sparked near Fintry Provincial Park on the west side of Okanagan Lake Saturday, Aug. 10, 2024.
The wildfire that sparked off Westside Road in the Fintry area on Saturday is now under control.
A new wildfire has sparked on the west side of Okanagan Lake Saturday, Aug. 10.
The fire is located near Fintry Provincial Park and is currently spot sized at an estimated 0.009 hectares.

title: Multiple sections of the Conestee Nature Preserve boardwalk closed due to flooding damage
message:
GREENVILLE, S.C. (FOX Carolina) - The Conestee Nature Preserve announced on their website that flooding damaged multiple sections of the preserve’s boardwalk on Saturday.
“You cannot currently complete the ‘loop’ using our yellow or green routes,” the preserve staff explained on their website.
“Please take these closures into account when planning your route.”This comes after the area received about five inches of rain in five hours, the preserve staff wrote in a Facebook post.
The damaged sections have been closed for repairs.
Copyright 2024 WHNS.

title: Season heaviest rainfall submerges Pindi - Pakistan
message:
It inundated low-lying areas of the garrison city forcing people to spend the rest of the day draining rainwater from their houses and shops.
He said that the water level in Leh increased to 11.8 feet and 10.5 feet at Kattarian and Gawalmandi bridges, respectively.
The downpour also damaged graves in Dhoke Ratta, Allahabad, Westridge and other parts of the city, as several new graves caved in.
Likewise, the Rawalpindi Municipal Corporation under the administrative control of the Rawalpindi commissioner failed to complete the carpeting of the roads.
Landslides may cause road closures in the vulnerable hilly areas of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Murree, Galiyat, Kashmir and Gilgit-Baltistan during the forecast period.
